meanings.definition: One who kisses or embraces amorously.
meanings.sent1: The little girl's pet dog was a friendly smoocher who loved to give wet kisses.
meanings.sent2: The romantic movie featured a passionate smoocher who swept the leading lady off her feet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten turned into a little smoocher, rubbing against everyone for attention.
meanings.sent4: The sun peeked through the clouds like a gentle smoocher planting kisses on the earth.
meanings.sent5: The old couple at the park were known as the sweetest smoochers, always holding hands and sharing kisses.

meanings.definition: A person who seeks to obtain something through flattery or charm.
meanings.sent1: The salesman was a smooth-talking smoocher who could convince anyone to buy his products.
meanings.sent2: The politician was known as a master smoocher, always complimenting others to gain their support.
meanings.sent3: The clever smoocher managed to get free samples at the store by charming the staff with compliments.
meanings.sent4: The sly fox in the fable was portrayed as a cunning smoocher who tricked others with sweet words.
meanings.sent5: The charming prince in the fairy tale was a skilled smoocher, winning over the princess with his words and gestures.
